items.title: US VC firm Expert Dojo launches $100m fund for Indian startups
items.summary:
- Expert Dojo launches its third global fund with a target of US$100 million, allocating US$15 million for Indian startups in fiscal year 2026.
- The fund will focus on sectors including fintech, B2B, SaaS, and AI, with individual investments between US$50,000 and US$1 million.
- An additional US$30 million is planned for investment in Indian startups over the next 2-3 years, alongside the opening of a new office in Bengaluru.

items.title: AI action figure trend takes over LinkedIn
Binance said to seek removal of US oversight
US tariffs force Samsung to rethink Vietnam, its key hub
items.summary:
- Samsung produces around 60% of its 220 million annual phone sales in Vietnam, heavily relying on exports to the US.
- The Trump administration proposed a temporary 10% tariff on Vietnamese exports, potentially increasing to 22%-28%.
- Samsung is considering increasing production in India or South Korea to adapt to these tariff changes, which may incur significant costs.

items.title: SenseTime plans major computing power boost in 2 years
items.summary:
- SenseTime aims to increase computing capacity significantly over the next two years, targeting high double to triple-digit annual growth.
- Achieved a 92% increase in computing power in 2024, reaching over 23,000 petaflops.
- Focus on domestic chip integration to reduce dependence on foreign technology due to US-China tensions.
- Early investments in infrastructure have positioned SenseTime advantageously in the growing AI market, projected to expand from $391 billion to $1.81 trillion by 2030.

items.title: Alphabet, Nvidia invest in former OpenAI scientist’s startup
Ex-OpenAI employees back Musk’s lawsuit to keep nonprofit status
items.summary:
- Twelve former OpenAI employees support a lawsuit to maintain the organization’s nonprofit status led by Elon Musk.
- The lawsuit argues that a shift to control by investors could undermine OpenAI’s humanitarian mission.
- Former employees stress that the nonprofit structure is essential for attracting talent and guiding strategy, while OpenAI states the transition is necessary for attracting investment to fund growth.

items.title: A16z said to lead funding for ex-OpenAI CTO Murati’s AI firm
items.summary:
- Andreessen Horowitz is negotiating to lead a funding round for Thinking Machines Lab, founded by Mira Murati, former OpenAI CTO.
- The funding round could value Thinking Machines Lab at $10 billion, with potential funding nearing $2 billion.
- The startup, launched in February 2025, aims to create safer AI systems and currently has approximately 30 researchers, mainly ex-OpenAI members.
- Notable advisers include former OpenAI leaders Bob McGrew and Alec Radford.
- This represents a trend where former OpenAI employees are rapidly attracting significant investments for new ventures.
- In 2024, global AI funding surpassed $100 billion, demonstrating a shift in venture capital towards AI investments, focusing more on team credentials than traditional revenue metrics.
- OpenAI's internal restructuring has led to significant departures, causing both challenges and new competition from its former executives.

items.title: South Korea’s startup funding, as explained in charts
items.summary:
- The article explores recent trends in startup funding in South Korea.
- It is divided into two sections: a weekly update on investors and macro trends in funding data.
- The content is presented through charts and graphics, but access requires a subscription.

items.title: YouTube launches AI-powered music tool for creators
items.summary:
- YouTube launched an AI tool called "Music Assistant" to help creators generate instrumental tracks without copyright issues.
- Users can input prompts like "uplifting and motivational music for a workout montage" to receive generated track options.
- This initiative is part of YouTube's strategy to integrate AI music tools, following previous features like a music remixer for Shorts.
- The U.S. Copyright Office's stance on AI-generated works not being eligible for copyright creates a clear legal framework for YouTube's tool.
- Recent reports indicate YouTube is negotiating licensing agreements to ensure fair compensation when using artists' works.
- The Music Assistant aligns with a trend of democratizing music creation, making it accessible to non-musicians.

items.title: Ex-Trump advisor, Stripe CEO join Meta’s board
items.summary:
- Meta appointed Dina Powell McCormick and Patrick Collison to its board effective April 15, 2025.
- Powell McCormick is a former Trump deputy national security advisor and has extensive experience in finance.
- Collison is the CEO of Stripe, a $65 billion valuation payments platform.
- Mark Zuckerberg highlighted their valuable business experience.
- The appointments reflect shifting political dynamics in Silicon Valley towards more Republican support.
- Meta's governance strategy includes political diversity to align with regulatory pressures and changing investor sentiments.

items.title: MoneyHero faces potential delisting as shares dip below $1
items.summary:
- MoneyHero may be delisted from Nasdaq after shares fell below $1 for 31 consecutive business days.
- Nasdaq notified MoneyHero of non-compliance with minimum bid price requirement on April 7.
- Shares closed at $0.74 on April 11; company has 180 days to regain compliance.
- MoneyHero is exploring options to address the situation and expresses confidence in ongoing operations.

items.title: Netflix tests OpenAI-powered search feature
items.summary:
- Netflix is testing a new search feature powered by OpenAI, enabling mood-based searches for shows.
- Currently available on iOS in Australia and New Zealand; planned US expansion in the coming weeks.
- The feature represents a shift from passive recommendations to interactive content discovery, enhancing user engagement and addressing gaps in search functionality.

items.title: Founders Fund closes $4.6b late-stage venture fund
items.author: Peter Thiel, Napoleon Ta, Trae Stephens
items.summary:
- Founders Fund has closed a $4.6 billion late-stage venture fund named Founders Fund Growth III as of April 11.
- The fund attracted contributions from 270 investors, primarily from the firm's general partners.
- This fund's size highlights a significant increase from the firm's initial $50 million fund in 2005, showcasing capital concentration in top-tier venture firms.
- The growth fund comes during a period of low IPO activity, providing necessary capital for mature startups while they await better market conditions.
- Founders Fund aims to capitalize on expected improved conditions for late-stage companies and a potential resurgence in IPOs in 2025.

items.title: Dropbox chief customer officer to step down as growth slows
items.summary:
- Dropbox's chief customer officer will step down as the company faces slowing growth.
- The leadership change comes amidst ongoing challenges in the tech industry.
- Dropbox has been shifting focus towards expanding its services beyond file storage.

items.title: Spotify invests $1.1m to boost French, Dutch audiobooks
items.summary:
- Spotify is investing $1.1 million to enhance its audiobooks offerings in French and Dutch.
- The investment aims to expand the diversity of content available in these languages.
- This move reflects Spotify's strategy to strengthen its position in the audiobook market.

items.title: Vanguard speeds up Singapore chip plant construction
Indian coliving firm Zolo sells student housing arm for $12.5m
items.summary:
- Zolo sells its student accommodation business to Good Host Spaces for ₹107.8 crore (US$12.5 million).
- Transaction structure includes 90% cash and 10% optionally convertible debentures (OCDs).
- Sale aims to improve liquidity and streamline operations amid increasing revenue but persistent losses.

items.title: Russian internet firm Yandex co-owner to increase stake in rival
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Pavel Prass, co-owner of Yandex, plans to increase his stake in rival VK.
- VK aims to raise up to 115 billion roubles by issuing 354 million shares at 324.9 roubles each.
- The plan, set for a shareholder vote on April 30, could allow AM-Invest and Agana to control 61% of VK’s capital.
- This indicates ongoing consolidation in Russia’s tech sector following a US$5.4 billion restructuring deal in July 2024.

items.title: WhatsApp launches new features to enhance group chats, users
items.summary:
- WhatsApp introduces an 'Online' indicator for active users in group chats.
- New 'Notify for' settings allow users to manage notifications for replies, mentions, and messages from saved contacts.
- Enhanced event management features include RSVP options and pinned events for easy access.
- iPhone users gain a document reader and voice message transcription capabilities.
- Improvements in video calling include joining calls directly from chat and pinch-to-zoom features.
- The update highlights a trend of messaging platforms converging towards similar functionalities.

items.title: China changes chip origin rule to boost local manufacturers
items.summary:
- China clarifies regulations on determining the origin of integrated circuits (ICs) by basing it on the wafer fabrication facility location.
- This change encourages developers to use local foundries like Semiconductor Manufacturing International Corporation (SMIC), leading to a 5.9% rise in SMIC's shares and a 14% increase in Hua Hong Semiconductor's shares.
- The move may raise production costs for US-made chips, potentially pushing manufacturers to relocate their facilities overseas amid escalating US-China trade tensions.

items.title: Indian supermarket chain More Retail eyes IPO in 2025
items.summary:
- More Retail, a Mumbai-based supermarket chain, plans to launch its IPO in 2025, according to managing director Vinod Nambiar.
- The company operates 775 stores in India, focusing on groceries, electronics, and clothing, using a hybrid model combining physical and online services.
- It aims to add over 500 stores in 160 cities in the next 18 months and double its store count in five years.
- Reported gross sales for FY25 were nearly 5,000 crore rupees (US$581.77 million), an 11% increase from the previous year, but standalone operating revenue for FY24 fell by 8%.
- More Retail serves as a fulfillment partner for Amazon Fresh, which provides higher margins than traditional retail.
- The company offers grocery delivery via its app, testing scheduled deliveries unlike competitors focused on quick delivery.
- The hybrid model positions More Retail differently in a rapidly expanding e-grocery market, where quick commerce has accounted for over two-thirds of orders and has grown significantly since 2022.
- The company noted persistent profitability challenges despite expanding, with its net loss narrowing only slightly from the previous year.

items.title: Meta set to begin antitrust trial on April 14
items.summary:
- Meta's antitrust trial against the FTC begins on **April 14** in **Washington**.
- The FTC claims Meta monopolizes personal social networking by acquiring Instagram for **$1 billion** in **2012** and WhatsApp for **$19 billion** in **2014**.
- **Mark Zuckerberg**, former COO **Sheryl Sandberg**, and executives from competitors like TikTok and Snap are set to testify.
- The trial will assess the FTC's definition of the social networking market and the impact of Meta's acquisitions on competition.
- Relevant historical cases such as Microsoft's 1990s antitrust case may provide context for the trial's outcomes.

items.title: India’s CarTrade shares rise 11% as market rallies on tariff pause
No IPO jitters for Fore Coffee
Trump tariffs threaten US services trade surplus with China
items.summary:
- China is considering restrictions on US services exports due to US tariffs.
- Key impacted sectors include education, travel, and entertainment.
- In 2023, the US had a $32 billion services trade surplus with China.
- Major US services exports to China include education, travel, intellectual property, and entertainment.
- [Source: Bloomberg](https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2025-04-11/trump-tariffs-put-us-services-trade-surplus-with-china-at-risk)

items.title: Ripple, US SEC suspend appeals to seek settlement
items.summary:
- Ripple Labs and the SEC filed a joint motion to pause ongoing legal appeals on April 11, 2025, for 60 days to pursue a potential settlement.
- They reached an agreement-in-principle pending SEC approval, addressing both the SEC's appeal and Ripple's cross-appeal.
- The legal dispute began in 2020, focusing on the SEC's claim that Ripple's sale of XRP tokens violated federal securities laws.

items.title: Kakao struggles with ongoing unit selloff rumors
items.summary:
- Kakao faces speculation about selling stakes in subsidiaries, which the company denied but acknowledged ongoing discussions.
- Kakao Entertainment's co-CEOs stated reports of a potential sale were misrepresented, with no decisions made yet.
- Kakao Entertainment reported a net loss of 259.1 billion won (approximately US$180.58 million) for 2024, raising financial stability concerns.
- VIG Partners is reportedly interested in acquiring a 40% stake in Kakao Mobility, potentially impacting Kakao’s management control.
- Speculations about selling the web portal Daum persist, despite CEO Chung Shin-a denying such intentions.
- Kakao's labor union insisted on protection against selling platforms that handle sensitive user data, highlighting trust issues with management.

items.title: Meet the 20 top-funded startups and tech companies in Hong Kong
Chinese yuan weakens to record low since 2007
items.summary:
- The Chinese yuan has reached its lowest value since 2007.
- The depreciation reflects ongoing economic pressures within China.
- Experts are discussing potential impacts on international trade and the global economy.

items.title: China raises tariffs to 125% in response to US hike
items.summary:
- China has increased tariffs on US goods to 125% as a response to the US raising duties on Chinese imports to 145%.
- This tariff hike is part of a larger ongoing trade dispute that is disrupting global supply chains.
- China’s Finance Ministry condemned the US actions, labeling them as unilateral and coercive, claiming they breach international trade rules.
- There has been no clear path provided by either nation toward resolving the escalating trade conflict.
- Historical context shows current tariffs are exceptionally high compared to norms established after WWII, deviating from decades of trade liberalization.
- Supply chain diversification efforts by US companies have been undermined by the new tariffs, complicating production strategies.

items.title: Yahoo removes DEI pages, aligns with US policy
items.summary:
- Yahoo has removed DEI pages from its corporate website, including the 2022 diversity report.
- Changes made between December 2024 and January 2025, resulting in a 60% reduction in site content.
- Other companies like Google, Meta, and Amazon have also altered their DEI content recently, reflecting industry-wide trends.
- Yahoo's spokesperson described the changes as part of a multi-phase redesign.
- The shift in DEI policies is tied to political transitions and regulatory pressures in the US.

items.title: SK Group chairman, TSMC chief discuss chip partnership
items.summary:
- SK Group Chairman Chey Tae-won met with TSMC CEO C.C. Wei to discuss semiconductor collaboration, especially in AI and HBM technology.
- This meeting follows a strategic partnership established in April 2024 between SK hynix and TSMC to enhance HBM production and advanced packaging.
- HBM technology is crucial for AI chip performance, and SK hynix holds over 50% of the global HBM market, with projected demand growing 82% annually through 2027.
- The competition in the semiconductor market is intensifying, with SK hynix narrowing the gap on Samsung in DRAM market share and potentially leading in next-gen HBM4 development.
- Micron Technology is also gaining market share amid competitive restructuring in the semiconductor market.

items.title: Uniqlo parent company posts $12.5b sales, record profit rise
items.summary:
- Fast Retailing, parent company of Uniqlo, reported record sales of ¥1.79 trillion (US$12.52 billion) for the six months ending in February, a 12% year-over-year increase.
- Operating profit grew 18.3% to ¥304.2 billion (US$2.13 billion), while net profit rose 19.2% to ¥233.5 billion (US$1.63 billion).
- The company anticipates operating profit to reach ¥545 billion (US$3.81 billion) and net profit to hit ¥410 billion (US$2.87 billion) for the full year.
- Domestic demand for Heattech garments and down jackets drove sales, with strong performance in Southeast Asia, North America, and Europe, despite declines in China and Hong Kong.

items.title: Tariffs may push Switch 2, PS5 prices to $590 in US
items.summary:
- Proposed tariffs could increase prices of the Switch 2 and PS5 in the US to $590.
- The tariffs are a response to ongoing trade tensions and may affect consumer electronics prices.
- The gaming industry is closely monitoring potential impacts on sales and market trends.

items.title: Computer parts maker Logitech withdraws 2026 forecast
Google lays off hundreds in platforms, devices division
Asia layoff tracker: latest on Microsoft JV in China, Aspire Indonesia
Shein gets UK IPO green light, awaits China’s final approval
items.summary:
- Shein has received approval from the UK’s Financial Conduct Authority (FCA) for its IPO in London.
- The company filed for the listing confidentially in June 2024 and awaits clearance from China's Securities Regulatory Commission (CSRC).
- Shein's valuation has dropped from a previous US$66 billion to an expected US$50 billion for the IPO due to market pressures and tariff impacts.
- Recent trade policy changes may affect Shein's pricing strategy in the US, which is its largest market.
- The CSRC’s approval may be delayed due to multiple regulatory bodies, pushing the IPO to later in 2025.
- Shein competes with Temu, which has a different business model and has expanded rapidly since its launch.
- Consumer concerns over inflation and tariffs may hinder Shein's growth post-IPO, as prices for fashion items are expected to rise.
- Shein's production is being diversified geographically, but this transition may take time to implement.

items.title: PUBG maker Krafton, Nvidia partners on AI game characters
items.summary:
- Krafton and Nvidia have announced a partnership to develop AI-driven game characters for PUBG.
- The collaboration aims to enhance player experiences by integrating advanced AI into game interactions.
- The partnership is expected to introduce new features that leverage Nvidia's graphics technology and AI capabilities.

items.title: Singapore’s top-funded tech companies in the last decade
items.summary:
- Singapore is recognized as a significant hub for tech startups, attracting substantial investor interest.
- An automated tracker is available to monitor the leading tech firms in Singapore regarding funding activities.
- The article emphasizes the difficulty in tracking funding activities due to the high volume of investments happening in the region.

items.title: LG Display finalizes $1.5b sale of China LCD plant to TCL
China unveils $8.2b AI fund to strengthen AI industry
items.summary:
- China announces a state fund worth 60 billion yuan (US$8.2 billion) for early-stage AI project investments.
- Launched by the Ministry of Industry and Information Technology (MIIT) and the Ministry of Finance to bolster the AI industry.
- Fund managed by Guozhi Investment in collaboration with the Big Fund, focusing on the entire AI supply chain.
- Initiative aligns with China's goal to enhance AI amid global competition and US semiconductor export restrictions.
- China accounted for 48% of global AI startup funding in 2017, showing its commitment to leading in AI technology.
- The fund aims to create a $150 billion AI industry by 2030, contributing to significant national economic projections.
keywords: Ministry of Industry and Information Technology

items.title: TikTok fuels ByteDance’s revenue to $155b
items.summary:
- ByteDance reported a 29% revenue increase for 2024, totaling US$155 billion.
- TikTok's global expansion contributed significantly, with international sales rising 63% to US$39 billion, representing 25% of total revenue.
- The company faced a deceleration in overall revenue growth compared to 2023, where revenue increased by 50% from US$80 billion to nearly US$120 billion.
- Douyin, ByteDance's flagship app, struggled due to China's economic slowdown, highlighting TikTok's vital role in revenue generation.
- TikTok users spend an average of 34 hours and 15 minutes on the app monthly, leading to substantial monetization opportunities and growing to 1.6 billion monthly active users by 2024.
- Geopolitical tensions, particularly US-China trade issues, pose risks to ByteDance's business model reliant on cross-border commerce.

items.title: Trump’s tariffs: Vietnam tightens dual-use export controls
items.summary:
• Vietnam addresses US trade concerns with new export controls on dual-use goods to prevent tariff evasions.
• The move follows scrutiny over Chinese goods re-exported with "Made in Vietnam" labels to bypass tariffs.
• A draft decree outlines new procedures for declaring and approving trade of sensitive products, coinciding with a temporary suspension of a 46% US tariff for 90 days.

items.title: Tesla halts Model S, Model X orders in China amid trade tensions
Myntra’s chief product, technology officer resigns
Singapore IT executive charged in US export fraud case
Sellers may raise prices on Chinese goods: Amazon CEO
Canva unveils new AI tools to attract enterprise clients
